reference.title: Fines and Holds
reference.shortdesc: In addition to checking out books, you must also be aware of fines, dues and folds.

section.title: Fines
section.p: When a book is overdue, you accumulate fines.

ol.li: Usually, a book may be borrowed for upto 3 weeks, unless it is a new book, in which case you may borrow it for 14 days. DVDs and other media may be borrowed for 2 weeks.
After the due date you may renew a book for 3 more weeks. Upto 3 Renewals are allowed. However, Renewals are not allowed for new books.
Cary Memorial library allows a 1 day grace period after the due date. After the due date and the grace period 10c per day is collected as fine..

section.title: Holds
section.p: You may login to your account online and keep a Hold on your book.
The online system has the catalogue of all the libraries within the state. Even if your book is not in Cary Memorial library, you may hold it, if it is available in some other library.
The inter-library service brings the book to Cary memorial library and intimates you via email when the book is ready to be picked up.
